help-file.title: JUSTICE
help-file.content:
Justice in hometowns when dealing with PKill/PSteal DEFINITIONS:
PKill: Player killing. (as opposed to mob killing)
PSteal: Player stealing. Stealing from, or attempting to steal from another player. "Aggro action": For the purposes in this message, an 'aggro action' is any form of physical or magical attack against another player (attempted PKill), OR PSteal.
Outcast: Being outcast from a hometown means that if you set foot in that hometown, there is the danger of a specialized group of guards coming to kill you.
NOTE: ALL OTHER RACES EXCEPT ELF AND HALF-ELF ARE CONSIDERED INVADERS TO CHARING, AND WILL BE HUNTED DOWN AND KILLED ON SITE!
HOW JUSTICE WORKS:
JUSTICE ONLY APPLIES IN GOOD ALIGNED HOMETOWNS!
-Any player that witnesses a crime in a hometown can report it to the justice. -If you commit a crime within a hometown and a citizen sees you he/she will report it to the justice. -When a crime is reported to the justice, guards will be sent to arrest the criminal (if he/she is still in town).
If a guard arrests you, you will be brought to jail and you will be judged for your crime during the next justice session. The sentence you get will depend on the crime you committed. In each hometown there is a justice hall. The following commands are available there :
Reporting a crime reporting <attacker> <crime> <victim> Pardoning someone for a crime against you pardon <name> Pay a dept to the town pay List all wanted criminals (see below) list Turn in a wanted criminal turn_in <name>
The list of supported crime is : Att_theft (attempted theft) Theft (theft) Att_murder (attempted murder) Murder (murder)
Wanted criminal Each hometown has a list of wanted criminals with the reward for bringing him in. If you catch a wanted criminal and bring him to justice you will get a reward for it. There is a new command "BIND" that you can use to bring a live criminal in.
Nothing prevents you from escaping jail, but if you do you will pay the price.
IMPORTANT -Pardoning a person for a crime against you does not prevent this person from going to jail but it will be used by the judge when he gives his/her sentence. -You cannot report a murder against yourself. -If someone commits a crime against you, you are not allowed to attack him, let justice take care of it. -A witnessed event is erased after a month, so dont wait too long to report a crime.
